Tom Emerson wrote:

> The documentation only hints at how to use the SurtPrefixScope.

Yeah.  Needs some work.

>
> I'm assuming that the surt patterns do not go into the seeds
> file. I assume I add a SurtPrefixFilter somewhere, but where?
>
I think your difficulty is not seeing the three little configuration 
options surts-source-file, seeds-as-surt-prefixes, and surts-dump-file 
(I'll try and move them up in the page -- one of the lads here asked for 
that a while ago). They follow transitiveFilter but are before 
http-headers in the order file.  Try setting seeds as you normally would 
and setting 'seeds-as-surt-prefixes' to TRUE (its default) paying 
attention to how surts parsing interprets trailing slashes, etc. (See 
the wiki page: http://crawler.archive.org/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?SurtScope).  
That should get you going.
St.Ack
